013package org.apache.juneau.objecttools;
014
015import static java.net.HttpURLConnection.*;
016import static org.apache.juneau.common.utils.Utils.*;
017
018import java.io.*;
019import java.lang.reflect.*;
020import java.util.*;
021
022import org.apache.juneau.*;
023import org.apache.juneau.collections.*;
024import org.apache.juneau.json.*;
025import org.apache.juneau.parser.*;
026
027/**
028 * POJO REST API.
029 *
030 * <p>
031 * Provides the ability to perform standard REST operations (GET, PUT, POST, DELETE) against nodes in a POJO model.
032 * Nodes in the POJO model are addressed using URLs.
033 *
034 * <p>
035 * A POJO model is defined as a tree model where nodes consist of consisting of the following:
036 * <ul class='spaced-list'>
037 *    <li>
038 *       {@link Map Maps} and Java beans representing JSON objects.
039 *    <li>
040 *       {@link Collection Collections} and arrays representing JSON arrays.
041 *    <li>
042 *       Java beans.
043 * </ul>
044 *
045 * <p>
046 * Leaves of the tree can be any type of object.
047 *
048 * <p>
049 * Use {@link #get(String) get()} to retrieve an element from a JSON tree.
050 * <br>Use {@link #put(String,Object) put()} to create (or overwrite) an element in a JSON tree.
051 * <br>Use {@link #post(String,Object) post()} to add an element to a list in a JSON tree.
052 * <br>Use {@link #delete(String) delete()} to remove an element from a JSON tree.
053 *
054 * <p>
055 * Leading slashes in URLs are ignored.
056 * So <js>"/xxx/yyy/zzz"</js> and <js>"xxx/yyy/zzz"</js> are considered identical.
057 *
058 * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
059 * <p class='bjava'>
060 *    <jc>// Construct an unstructured POJO model</jc>
061 *    JsonMap <jv>map</jv> = JsonMap.<jsm>ofJson</jsm>(<js>""</js>
062 *       + <js>"{"</js>
063 *       + <js>"  name:'John Smith', "</js>
064 *       + <js>"  address:{ "</js>
065 *       + <js>"     streetAddress:'21 2nd Street', "</js>
066 *       + <js>"     city:'New York', "</js>
067 *       + <js>"     state:'NY', "</js>
068 *       + <js>"     postalCode:10021 "</js>
069 *       + <js>"  }, "</js>
070 *       + <js>"  phoneNumbers:[ "</js>
071 *       + <js>"     '212 555-1111', "</js>
072 *       + <js>"     '212 555-2222' "</js>
073 *       + <js>"  ], "</js>
074 *       + <js>"  additionalInfo:null, "</js>
075 *       + <js>"  remote:false, "</js>
076 *       + <js>"  height:62.4, "</js>
077 *       + <js>"  'fico score':' &gt; 640' "</js>
078 *       + <js>"} "</js>
079 *    );
080 *
081 *    <jc>// Wrap Map inside an ObjectRest object</jc>
082 *    ObjectRest <jv>johnSmith</jv> = ObjectRest.<jsm>create</jsm>(<jv>map</jv>);
083 *
084 *    <jc>// Get a simple value at the top level</jc>
085 *    <jc>// "John Smith"</jc>
086 *    String <jv>name</jv> = <jv>johnSmith</jv>.getString(<js>"name"</js>);
087 *
088 *    <jc>// Change a simple value at the top level</jc>
089 *    <jv>johnSmith</jv>.put(<js>"name"</js>, <js>"The late John Smith"</js>);
090 *
091 *    <jc>// Get a simple value at a deep level</jc>
092 *    <jc>// "21 2nd Street"</jc>
093 *    String <jv>streetAddress</jv> = <jv>johnSmith</jv>.getString(<js>"address/streetAddress"</js>);
094 *
095 *    <jc>// Set a simple value at a deep level</jc>
096 *    <jv>johnSmith</jv>.put(<js>"address/streetAddress"</js>, <js>"101 Cemetery Way"</js>);
097 *
098 *    <jc>// Get entries in a list</jc>
099 *    <jc>// "212 555-1111"</jc>
100 *    String <jv>firstPhoneNumber</jv> = <jv>johnSmith</jv>.getString(<js>"phoneNumbers/0"</js>);
101 *
102 *    <jc>// Add entries to a list</jc>
103 *    <jv>johnSmith</jv>.post(<js>"phoneNumbers"</js>, <js>"212 555-3333"</js>);
104 *
105 *    <jc>// Delete entries from a model</jc>
106 *    <jv>johnSmith</jv>.delete(<js>"fico score"</js>);
107 *
108 *    <jc>// Add entirely new structures to the tree</jc>
109 *    JsonMap <jv>medicalInfo</jv> = JsonMap.<jsm>ofJson</jsm>(<js>""</js>
110 *       + <js>"{"</js>
111 *       + <js>"  currentStatus: 'deceased',"</js>
112 *       + <js>"  health: 'non-existent',"</js>
113 *       + <js>"  creditWorthiness: 'not good'"</js>
114 *       + <js>"}"</js>
115 *    );
116 *    <jv>johnSmith</jv>.put(<js>"additionalInfo/medicalInfo"</js>, <jv>medicalInfo</jv>);
117 * </p>
118 *
119 * <p>
120 * In the special case of collections/arrays of maps/beans, a special XPath-like selector notation can be used in lieu
121 * of index numbers on GET requests to return a map/bean with a specified attribute value.
122 * <br>The syntax is {@code @attr=val}, where attr is the attribute name on the child map, and val is the matching value.
123 *
124 * <h5 class='section'>Example:</h5>
125 * <p class='bjava'>
126 *    <jc>// Get map/bean with name attribute value of 'foo' from a list of items</jc>
127 *    Map <jv>map</jv> = <jv>objectRest</jv>.getMap(<js>"/items/@name=foo"</js>);
128 * </p>
129 *
130 * <h5 class='section'>See Also:</h5><ul>
131
132 * </ul>
133 */
134@SuppressWarnings({"unchecked","rawtypes"})
135public class ObjectRest {
136
137   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
138   // Static
139   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
140
141   /** The list of possible request types. */
142   private static final int GET=1, PUT=2, POST=3, DELETE=4;
143
144   /**
145    * Static creator.
146    * @param o The object being wrapped.
147    * @return A new {@link ObjectRest} object.
148    */
149   public static ObjectRest create(Object o) {
150      return new ObjectRest(o);
151   }
152
153   /**
154    * Static creator.
155    * @param o The object being wrapped.
156    * @param parser The parser to use for parsing arguments and converting objects to the correct data type.
157    * @return A new {@link ObjectRest} object.
158    */
159   public static ObjectRest create(Object o, ReaderParser parser) {
160      return new ObjectRest(o, parser);
161   }
162
163   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
164   // Instance
165   //-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
166
167   private ReaderParser parser = JsonParser.DEFAULT;
168   final BeanSession session;
169
170   /** If true, the root cannot be overwritten */
171   private boolean rootLocked;
172
173   /** The root of the model. */
174   private JsonNode root;
175
176   /**
177    * Create a new instance of a REST interface over the specified object.
178    *
179    * <p>
180    * Uses {@link BeanContext#DEFAULT} for working with Java beans.
181    *
182    * @param o The object to be wrapped.
183    */
184   public ObjectRest(Object o) {
185      this(o, null);
186   }
187
188   /**
189    * Create a new instance of a REST interface over the specified object.
190    *
191    * <p>
192    * The parser is used as the bean context.
193    *
194    * @param o The object to be wrapped.
195    * @param parser The parser to use for parsing arguments and converting objects to the correct data type.
196    */
197   public ObjectRest(Object o, ReaderParser parser) {
198      this.session = parser == null ? BeanContext.DEFAULT_SESSION : parser.getBeanContext().getSession();
199      if (parser == null)
200         parser = JsonParser.DEFAULT;
201      this.parser = parser;
202      this.root = new JsonNode(null, null, o, session.object());
203   }
204
205   /**
206    * Call this method to prevent the root object from being overwritten on <c>put("", xxx);</c> calls.
207    *
208    * @return This object.
209    */
210   public ObjectRest setRootLocked() {
211      this.rootLocked = true;
212      return this;
213   }
214
215   /**
216    * The root object that was passed into the constructor of this method.
217    *
218    * @return The root object.
219    */
220   public Object getRootObject() {
221      return root.o;
222   }
223
224   /**
225    * Retrieves the element addressed by the URL.
226    *
227    * @param url
228    *    The URL of the element to retrieve.
229    *    <br>If <jk>null</jk> or blank, returns the root.
230    * @return The addressed element, or <jk>null</jk> if that element does not exist in the tree.
231    */
232   public Object get(String url) {
233      return getWithDefault(url, null);
234   }
235
236   /**
237    * Retrieves the element addressed by the URL.
238    *
239    * @param url
240    *    The URL of the element to retrieve.
241    *    <br>If <jk>null</jk> or blank, returns the root.
242    * @param defVal The default value if the map doesn't contain the specified mapping.
243    * @return The addressed element, or null if that element does not exist in the tree.
244    */
245   public Object getWithDefault(String url, Object defVal) {
246      Object o = service(GET, url, null);
247      return o == null ? defVal : o;
248   }
249
250   /**
251    * Retrieves the element addressed by the URL as the specified object type.
252    *
253    * <p>
254    * Will convert object to the specified type per {@link BeanSession#convertToType(Object, Class)}.
255    *
256    * <h5 class='section'>Examples:</h5>
257    * <p class='bjava'>
258    *    ObjectRest <jv>objectRest</jv> = <jk>new</jk> ObjectRest(<jv>object</jv>);
259    *
260    *    <jc>// Value converted to a string.</jc>
261    *    String <jv>string</jv> = <jv>objectRest</jv>.get(<js>"path/to/string"</js>, String.<jk>class</jk>);
262    *
263    *    <jc>// Value converted to a bean.</jc>
264    *    MyBean <jv>bean</jv> = <jv>objectRest</jv>.get(<js>"path/to/bean"</js>, MyBean.<jk>class</jk>);
265    *
266    *    <jc>// Value converted to a bean array.</jc>
267    *    MyBean[] <jv>beanArray</jv> = <jv>objectRest</jv>.get(<js>"path/to/beanarray"</js>, MyBean[].<jk>class</jk>);
268    *
269    *    <jc>// Value converted to a linked-list of objects.</jc>
270    *    List <jv>list</jv> = <jv>objectRest</jv>.get(<js>"path/to/list"</js>, LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>);
271    *
272    *    <jc>// Value converted to a map of object keys/values.</jc>
273    *    Map <jv>map</jv> = <jv>objectRest</jv>.get(<js>"path/to/map"</js>, TreeMap.<jk>class</jk>);
274    * </p>
275    *
276    * @param url
277    *    The URL of the element to retrieve.
278    *    If <jk>null</jk> or blank, returns the root.
279    * @param type The specified object type.
280    *
281    * @param <T> The specified object type.
282    * @return The addressed element, or null if that element does not exist in the tree.
283    */
284   public <T> T get(String url, Class<T> type) {
285      return getWithDefault(url, null, type);
286   }
287
288   /**
289    * Retrieves the element addressed by the URL as the specified object type.
290    *
291    * <p>
292    * Will convert object to the specified type per {@link BeanSession#convertToType(Object, Class)}.
293    *
294    * <p>
295    * The type can be a simple type (e.g. beans, strings, numbers) or parameterized type (collections/maps).
296    *
297    * <h5 class='section'>Examples:</h5>
298    * <p class='bjava'>
299    *    ObjectRest <jv>objectRest</jv> = <jk>new</jk> ObjectRest(<jv>object</jv>);
300    *
301    *    <jc>// Value converted to a linked-list of strings.</jc>
302    *    List&lt;String&gt; <jv>list1</jv> = <jv>objectRest</jv>.get(<js>"path/to/list1"</js>, LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>);
303    *
304    *    <jc>// Value converted to a linked-list of beans.</jc>
305    *    List&lt;MyBean&gt; <jv>list2</jv> = <jv>objectRest</jv>.get(<js>"path/to/list2"</js>, LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, MyBean.<jk>class</jk>);
306    *
307    *    <jc>// Value converted to a linked-list of linked-lists of strings.</jc>
308    *    List&lt;List&lt;String&gt;&gt; <jv>list3</jv> = <jv>objectRest</jv>.get(<js>"path/to/list3"</js>, LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, LinkedList.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>);
309    *
310    *    <jc>// Value converted to a map of string keys/values.</jc>
311    *    Map&lt;String,String&gt; <jv>map1</jv> = <jv>objectRest</jv>.get(<js>"path/to/map1"</js>, TreeMap.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>);
312    *
313    *    <jc>// Value converted to a map containing string keys and values of lists containing beans.</jc>
314    *    Map&lt;String,List&lt;MyBean&gt;&gt; <jv>map2</jv> = <jv>objectRest</jv>.get(<js>"path/to/map2"</js>, TreeMap.<jk>class</jk>, String.<jk>class</jk>, List.<jk>class</jk>, MyBean.<jk>class</jk>);
315    * </p>
316    *
317    * <p>
318    * <c>Collection</c> classes are assumed to be followed by zero or one objects indicating the element type.
319    *
320    * <p>
321    * <c>Map</c> classes are assumed to be followed by zero or two meta objects indicating the key and value types.
322    *
323    * <p>
324    * The array can be arbitrarily long to indicate arbitrarily complex data structures.
325    *
326    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
327    *    <li class='note'>
328    *       Use the {@link #get(String, Class)} method instead if you don't need a parameterized map/collection.
329    * </ul>
330    *
331    * @param url
332    *    The URL of the element to retrieve.
333    *    If <jk>null</jk> or blank, returns the root.
334    * @param type The specified object type.
335    * @param args The specified object parameter types.
336    *
337    * @param <T> The specified object type.
338    * @return The addressed element, or null if that element does not exist in the tree.
339    */
340   public <T> T get(String url, Type type, Type...args) {
341      return getWithDefault(url, null, type, args);
342   }
343
344   /**
345    * Same as {@link #get(String, Class)} but returns a default value if the addressed element is null or non-existent.
346    *
347    * @param url
348    *    The URL of the element to retrieve.
349    *    If <jk>null</jk> or blank, returns the root.
350    * @param def The default value if addressed item does not exist.
351    * @param type The specified object type.
352    *
353    * @param <T> The specified object type.
354    * @return The addressed element, or null if that element does not exist in the tree.
355    */
356   public <T> T getWithDefault(String url, T def, Class<T> type) {
357      Object o = service(GET, url, null);
358      if (o == null)
359         return def;
360      return session.convertToType(o, type);
361   }
362
363   /**
364    * Same as {@link #get(String,Type,Type[])} but returns a default value if the addressed element is null or non-existent.
365    *
366    * @param url
367    *    The URL of the element to retrieve.
368    *    If <jk>null</jk> or blank, returns the root.
369    * @param def The default value if addressed item does not exist.
370    * @param type The specified object type.
371    * @param args The specified object parameter types.
372    *
373    * @param <T> The specified object type.
374    * @return The addressed element, or null if that element does not exist in the tree.
375    */
376   public <T> T getWithDefault(String url, T def, Type type, Type...args) {
377      Object o = service(GET, url, null);
378      if (o == null)
379         return def;
380      return session.convertToType(o, type, args);
381   }
382
383   /**
384    * Returns the specified entry value converted to a {@link String}.
385    *
386    * <p>
387    * Shortcut for <code>get(String.<jk>class</jk>, key)</code>.
388    *
389    * @param url The key.
390    * @return The converted value, or <jk>null</jk> if the map contains no mapping for this key.
391    */
392   public String getString(String url) {
393      return get(url, String.class);
394   }
395
396   /**
397    * Returns the specified entry value converted to a {@link String}.
398    *
399    * <p>
400    * Shortcut for <code>get(String.<jk>class</jk>, key, defVal)</code>.
401    *
402    * @param url The key.
403    * @param defVal The default value if the map doesn't contain the specified mapping.
404    * @return The converted value, or the default value if the map contains no mapping for this key.
405    */
406   public String getString(String url, String defVal) {
407      return getWithDefault(url, defVal, String.class);
408   }
409
410   /**
411    * Returns the specified entry value converted to an {@link Integer}.
412    *
413    * <p>
414    * Shortcut for <code>get(Integer.<jk>class</jk>, key)</code>.
415    *
416    * @param url The key.
417    * @return The converted value, or <jk>null</jk> if the map contains no mapping for this key.
418    * @throws InvalidDataConversionException If value cannot be converted.
419    */
420   public Integer getInt(String url) {
421      return get(url, Integer.class);
422   }
423
424   /**
425    * Returns the specified entry value converted to an {@link Integer}.
426    *
427    * <p>
428    * Shortcut for <code>get(Integer.<jk>class</jk>, key, defVal)</code>.
429    *
430    * @param url The key.
431    * @param defVal The default value if the map doesn't contain the specified mapping.
432    * @return The converted value, or the default value if the map contains no mapping for this key.
433    * @throws InvalidDataConversionException If value cannot be converted.
434    */
435   public Integer getInt(String url, Integer defVal) {
436      return getWithDefault(url, defVal, Integer.class);
437   }
438
439   /**
440    * Returns the specified entry value converted to a {@link Long}.
441    *
442    * <p>
443    * Shortcut for <code>get(Long.<jk>class</jk>, key)</code>.
444    *
445    * @param url The key.
446    * @return The converted value, or <jk>null</jk> if the map contains no mapping for this key.
447    * @throws InvalidDataConversionException If value cannot be converted.
448    */
449   public Long getLong(String url) {
450      return get(url, Long.class);
451   }
452
453   /**
454    * Returns the specified entry value converted to a {@link Long}.
455    *
456    * <p>
457    * Shortcut for <code>get(Long.<jk>class</jk>, key, defVal)</code>.
458    *
459    * @param url The key.
460    * @param defVal The default value if the map doesn't contain the specified mapping.
461    * @return The converted value, or the default value if the map contains no mapping for this key.
462    * @throws InvalidDataConversionException If value cannot be converted.
463    */
464   public Long getLong(String url, Long defVal) {
465      return getWithDefault(url, defVal, Long.class);
466   }
467
468   /**
469    * Returns the specified entry value converted to a {@link Boolean}.
470    *
471    * <p>
472    * Shortcut for <code>get(Boolean.<jk>class</jk>, key)</code>.
473    *
474    * @param url The key.
475    * @return The converted value, or <jk>null</jk> if the map contains no mapping for this key.
476    * @throws InvalidDataConversionException If value cannot be converted.
477    */
478   public Boolean getBoolean(String url) {
479      return get(url, Boolean.class);
480   }
481
482   /**
483    * Returns the specified entry value converted to a {@link Boolean}.
484    *
485    * <p>
486    * Shortcut for <code>get(Boolean.<jk>class</jk>, key, defVal)</code>.
487    *
488    * @param url The key.
489    * @param defVal The default value if the map doesn't contain the specified mapping.
490    * @return The converted value, or the default value if the map contains no mapping for this key.
491    * @throws InvalidDataConversionException If value cannot be converted.
492    */
493   public Boolean getBoolean(String url, Boolean defVal) {
494      return getWithDefault(url, defVal, Boolean.class);
495   }
496
497   /**
498    * Returns the specified entry value converted to a {@link Map}.
499    *
500    * <p>
501    * Shortcut for <code>get(Map.<jk>class</jk>, key)</code>.
502    *
503    * @param url The key.
504    * @return The converted value, or <jk>null</jk> if the map contains no mapping for this key.
505    * @throws InvalidDataConversionException If value cannot be converted.
506    */
507   public Map<?,?> getMap(String url) {
508      return get(url, Map.class);
509   }
510
511   /**
512    * Returns the specified entry value converted to a {@link Map}.
513    *
514    * <p>
515    * Shortcut for <code>get(Map.<jk>class</jk>, key, defVal)</code>.
516    *
517    * @param url The key.
518    * @param defVal The default value if the map doesn't contain the specified mapping.
519    * @return The converted value, or the default value if the map contains no mapping for this key.
520    * @throws InvalidDataConversionException If value cannot be converted.
521    */
522   public Map<?,?> getMap(String url, Map<?,?> defVal) {
523      return getWithDefault(url, defVal, Map.class);
524   }
525
526   /**
527    * Returns the specified entry value converted to a {@link List}.
528    *
529    * <p>
530    * Shortcut for <code>get(List.<jk>class</jk>, key)</code>.
531    *
532    * @param url The key.
533    * @return The converted value, or <jk>null</jk> if the map contains no mapping for this key.
534    * @throws InvalidDataConversionException If value cannot be converted.
535    */
536   public List<?> getList(String url) {
537      return get(url, List.class);
538   }
539
540   /**
541    * Returns the specified entry value converted to a {@link List}.
542    *
543    * <p>
544    * Shortcut for <code>get(List.<jk>class</jk>, key, defVal)</code>.
545    *
546    * @param url The key.
547    * @param defVal The default value if the map doesn't contain the specified mapping.
548    * @return The converted value, or the default value if the map contains no mapping for this key.
549    * @throws InvalidDataConversionException If value cannot be converted.
550    */
551   public List<?> getList(String url, List<?> defVal) {
552      return getWithDefault(url, defVal, List.class);
553   }
554
555   /**
556    * Returns the specified entry value converted to a {@link Map}.
557    *
558    * <p>
559    * Shortcut for <code>get(JsonMap.<jk>class</jk>, key)</code>.
560    *
561    * @param url The key.
562    * @return The converted value, or <jk>null</jk> if the map contains no mapping for this key.
563    * @throws InvalidDataConversionException If value cannot be converted.
564    */
565   public JsonMap getJsonMap(String url) {
566      return get(url, JsonMap.class);
567   }
568
569   /**
570    * Returns the specified entry value converted to a {@link JsonMap}.
571    *
572    * <p>
573    * Shortcut for <code>get(JsonMap.<jk>class</jk>, key, defVal)</code>.
574    *
575    * @param url The key.
576    * @param defVal The default value if the map doesn't contain the specified mapping.
577    * @return The converted value, or the default value if the map contains no mapping for this key.
578    * @throws InvalidDataConversionException If value cannot be converted.
579    */
580   public JsonMap getJsonMap(String url, JsonMap defVal) {
581      return getWithDefault(url, defVal, JsonMap.class);
582   }
583
584   /**
585    * Returns the specified entry value converted to a {@link JsonList}.
586    *
587    * <p>
588    * Shortcut for <code>get(JsonList.<jk>class</jk>, key)</code>.
589    *
590    * @param url The key.
591    * @return The converted value, or <jk>null</jk> if the map contains no mapping for this key.
592    * @throws InvalidDataConversionException If value cannot be converted.
593    */
594   public JsonList getJsonList(String url) {
595      return get(url, JsonList.class);
596   }
597
598   /**
599    * Returns the specified entry value converted to a {@link JsonList}.
600    *
601    * <p>
602    * Shortcut for <code>get(JsonList.<jk>class</jk>, key, defVal)</code>.
603    *
604    * @param url The key.
605    * @param defVal The default value if the map doesn't contain the specified mapping.
606    * @return The converted value, or the default value if the map contains no mapping for this key.
607    * @throws InvalidDataConversionException If value cannot be converted.
608    */
609   public JsonList getJsonList(String url, JsonList defVal) {
610      return getWithDefault(url, defVal, JsonList.class);
611   }
612
613   /**
614    * Executes the specified method with the specified parameters on the specified object.
615    *
616    * @param url The URL of the element to retrieve.
617    * @param method
618    *    The method signature.
619    *    <p>
620    *    Can be any of the following formats:
621    *    <ul class='spaced-list'>
622    *       <li>
623    *          Method name only.  e.g. <js>"myMethod"</js>.
624    *       <li>
625    *          Method name with class names.  e.g. <js>"myMethod(String,int)"</js>.
626    *       <li>
627    *          Method name with fully-qualified class names.  e.g. <js>"myMethod(java.util.String,int)"</js>.
628    *    </ul>
629    *    <p>
630    *    As a rule, use the simplest format needed to uniquely resolve a method.
631    * @param args
632    *    The arguments to pass as parameters to the method.
633    *    These will automatically be converted to the appropriate object type if possible.
634    *    This must be an array, like a JSON array.
635    * @return The returned object from the method call.
636    * @throws ExecutableException Exception occurred on invoked constructor/method/field.
637    * @throws ParseException Malformed input encountered.
638    * @throws IOException Thrown by underlying stream.
639    */
640   public Object invokeMethod(String url, String method, String args) throws ExecutableException, ParseException, IOException {
641      try {
642         return new ObjectIntrospector(get(url), parser).invokeMethod(method, args);
643      } catch (NoSuchMethodException | IllegalArgumentException | InvocationTargetException | IllegalAccessException e) {
644         throw new ExecutableException(e);
645      }
646   }
647
648   /**
649    * Returns the list of available methods that can be passed to the {@link #invokeMethod(String, String, String)}
650    * for the object addressed by the specified URL.
651    *
652    * @param url The URL.
653    * @return The list of methods.
654    */
655   public Collection<String> getPublicMethods(String url) {
656      Object o = get(url);
657      if (o == null)
658         return null;
659      return session.getClassMeta(o.getClass()).getPublicMethods().keySet();
660   }
661
662   /**
663    * Returns the class type of the object at the specified URL.
664    *
665    * @param url The URL.
666    * @return The class type.
667    */
668   public ClassMeta getClassMeta(String url) {
669      JsonNode n = getNode(normalizeUrl(url), root);
670      if (n == null)
671         return null;
672      return n.cm;
673   }
674
675   /**
676    * Sets/replaces the element addressed by the URL.
677    *
678    * <p>
679    * This method expands the POJO model as necessary to create the new element.
680    *
681    * @param url
682    *    The URL of the element to create.
683    *    If <jk>null</jk> or blank, the root itself is replaced with the specified value.
684    * @param val The value being set.  Value can be of any type.
685    * @return The previously addressed element, or <jk>null</jk> the element did not previously exist.
686    */
687   public Object put(String url, Object val) {
688      return service(PUT, url, val);
689   }
690
691   /**
692    * Adds a value to a list element in a POJO model.
693    *
694    * <p>
695    * The URL is the address of the list being added to.
696    *
697    * <p>
698    * If the list does not already exist, it will be created.
699    *
700    * <p>
701    * This method expands the POJO model as necessary to create the new element.
702    *
703    * <h5 class='section'>Notes:</h5><ul>
704    *    <li class='note'>
705    *       You can only post to three types of nodes:
706    *       <ul>
707    *          <li>{@link List Lists}
708    *          <li>{@link Map Maps} containing integers as keys (i.e sparse arrays)
709    *          <li>arrays
710    *       </ul>
711    * </ul>
712    *
713    * @param url
714    *    The URL of the element being added to.
715    *    If <jk>null</jk> or blank, the root itself (assuming it's one of the types specified above) is added to.
716    * @param val The value being added.
717    * @return The URL of the element that was added.
718    */
719   public String post(String url, Object val) {
720      return (String)service(POST, url, val);
721   }
722
723   /**
724    * Remove an element from a POJO model.
725    *
726    * <p>
727    * If the element does not exist, no action is taken.
728    *
729    * @param url
730    *    The URL of the element being deleted.
731    *    If <jk>null</jk> or blank, the root itself is deleted.
732    * @return The removed element, or null if that element does not exist.
733    */
734   public Object delete(String url) {
735      return service(DELETE, url, null);
736   }
737
738   @Override /* Object */
739   public String toString() {
740      return String.valueOf(root.o);
741   }
742
743   /** Handle nulls and strip off leading '/' char. */
744   private static String normalizeUrl(String url) {
745
746      // Interpret nulls and blanks the same (i.e. as addressing the root itself)
747      if (url == null)
748         url = "";
749
750      // Strip off leading slash if present.
751      if (isNotEmpty(url) && url.charAt(0) == '/')
752         url = url.substring(1);
753
754      return url;
755   }
756
757
758   /*
759    * Workhorse method.
760    */
761   private Object service(int method, String url, Object val) throws ObjectRestException {
762
763      url = normalizeUrl(url);
764
765      if (method == GET) {
766         JsonNode p = getNode(url, root);
767         return p == null ? null : p.o;
768      }
769
770      // Get the url of the parent and the property name of the addressed object.
771      int i = url.lastIndexOf('/');
772      String parentUrl = (i == -1 ? null : url.substring(0, i));
773      String childKey = (i == -1 ? url : url.substring(i + 1));
774
775      if (method == PUT) {
776         if (url.isEmpty()) {
777            if (rootLocked)
778               throw new ObjectRestException(HTTP_FORBIDDEN, "Cannot overwrite root object");
779            Object o = root.o;
780            root = new JsonNode(null, null, val, session.object());
781            return o;
782         }
783         JsonNode n = (parentUrl == null ? root : getNode(parentUrl, root));
784         if (n == null)
785            throw new ObjectRestException(HTTP_NOT_FOUND, "Node at URL ''{0}'' not found.", parentUrl);
786         ClassMeta cm = n.cm;
787         Object o = n.o;
788         if (cm.isMap())
789            return ((Map)o).put(childKey, convert(val, cm.getValueType()));
790         if (cm.isCollection() && o instanceof List)
791            return ((List)o).set(parseInt(childKey), convert(val, cm.getElementType()));
792         if (cm.isArray()) {
793            o = setArrayEntry(n.o, parseInt(childKey), val, cm.getElementType());
794            ClassMeta pct = n.parent.cm;
795            Object po = n.parent.o;
796            if (pct.isMap()) {
797               ((Map)po).put(n.keyName, o);
798               return url;
799            }
800            if (pct.isBean()) {
801               BeanMap m = session.toBeanMap(po);
802               m.put(n.keyName, o);
803               return url;
804            }
805            throw new ObjectRestException(HTTP_BAD_REQUEST, "Cannot perform PUT on ''{0}'' with parent node type ''{1}''", url, pct);
806         }
807         if (cm.isBean())
808            return session.toBeanMap(o).put(childKey, val);
809         throw new ObjectRestException(HTTP_BAD_REQUEST, "Cannot perform PUT on ''{0}'' whose parent is of type ''{1}''", url, cm);
810      }
811
812      if (method == POST) {
813         // Handle POST to root special
814         if (url.isEmpty()) {
815            ClassMeta cm = root.cm;
816            Object o = root.o;
817            if (cm.isCollection()) {
818               Collection c = (Collection)o;
819               c.add(convert(val, cm.getElementType()));
820               return (c instanceof List ? url + "/" + (c.size()-1) : null);
821            }
822            if (cm.isArray()) {
823               Object[] o2 = addArrayEntry(o, val, cm.getElementType());
824               root = new JsonNode(null, null, o2, null);
825               return url + "/" + (o2.length-1);
826            }
827            throw new ObjectRestException(HTTP_BAD_REQUEST, "Cannot perform POST on ''{0}'' of type ''{1}''", url, cm);
828         }
829         JsonNode n = getNode(url, root);
830         if (n == null)
831            throw new ObjectRestException(HTTP_NOT_FOUND, "Node at URL ''{0}'' not found.", url);
832         ClassMeta cm = n.cm;
833         Object o = n.o;
834         if (cm.isArray()) {
835            Object[] o2 = addArrayEntry(o, val, cm.getElementType());
836            ClassMeta pct = n.parent.cm;
837            Object po = n.parent.o;
838            if (pct.isMap()) {
839               ((Map)po).put(childKey, o2);
840               return url + "/" + (o2.length-1);
841            }
842            if (pct.isBean()) {
843               BeanMap m = session.toBeanMap(po);
844               m.put(childKey, o2);
845               return url + "/" + (o2.length-1);
846            }
847            throw new ObjectRestException(HTTP_BAD_REQUEST, "Cannot perform POST on ''{0}'' with parent node type ''{1}''", url, pct);
848         }
849         if (cm.isCollection()) {
850            Collection c = (Collection)o;
851            c.add(convert(val, cm.getElementType()));
852            return (c instanceof List ? url + "/" + (c.size()-1) : null);
853         }
854         throw new ObjectRestException(HTTP_BAD_REQUEST, "Cannot perform POST on ''{0}'' of type ''{1}''", url, cm);
855      }
856
857      if (method == DELETE) {
858         if (url.isEmpty()) {
859            if (rootLocked)
860               throw new ObjectRestException(HTTP_FORBIDDEN, "Cannot overwrite root object");
861            Object o = root.o;
862            root = new JsonNode(null, null, null, session.object());
863            return o;
864         }
865         JsonNode n = (parentUrl == null ? root : getNode(parentUrl, root));
866         ClassMeta cm = n.cm;
867         Object o = n.o;
868         if (cm.isMap())
869            return ((Map)o).remove(childKey);
870         if (cm.isCollection() && o instanceof List)
871            return ((List)o).remove(parseInt(childKey));
872         if (cm.isArray()) {
873            int index = parseInt(childKey);
874            Object old = ((Object[])o)[index];
875            Object[] o2 = removeArrayEntry(o, index);
876            ClassMeta pct = n.parent.cm;
877            Object po = n.parent.o;
878            if (pct.isMap()) {
879               ((Map)po).put(n.keyName, o2);
880               return old;
881            }
882            if (pct.isBean()) {
883               BeanMap m = session.toBeanMap(po);
884               m.put(n.keyName, o2);
885               return old;
886            }
887            throw new ObjectRestException(HTTP_BAD_REQUEST, "Cannot perform POST on ''{0}'' with parent node type ''{1}''", url, pct);
888         }
889         if (cm.isBean())
890            return session.toBeanMap(o).put(childKey, null);
891         throw new ObjectRestException(HTTP_BAD_REQUEST, "Cannot perform PUT on ''{0}'' whose parent is of type ''{1}''", url, cm);
892      }
893
894      return null;   // Never gets here.
895   }
896
897   private Object[] setArrayEntry(Object o, int index, Object val, ClassMeta componentType) {
898      Object[] a = (Object[])o;
899      if (a.length <= index) {
900         // Expand out the array.
901         Object[] a2 = (Object[])Array.newInstance(a.getClass().getComponentType(), index+1);
902         System.arraycopy(a, 0, a2, 0, a.length);
903         a = a2;
904      }
905      a[index] = convert(val, componentType);
906      return a;
907   }
908
909   private Object[] addArrayEntry(Object o, Object val, ClassMeta componentType) {
910      Object[] a = (Object[])o;
911      // Expand out the array.
912      Object[] a2 = (Object[])Array.newInstance(a.getClass().getComponentType(), a.length+1);
913      System.arraycopy(a, 0, a2, 0, a.length);
914      a2[a.length] = convert(val, componentType);
915      return a2;
916   }
917
918   private static Object[] removeArrayEntry(Object o, int index) {
919      Object[] a = (Object[])o;
920      // Shrink the array.
921      Object[] a2 = (Object[])Array.newInstance(a.getClass().getComponentType(), a.length-1);
922      System.arraycopy(a, 0, a2, 0, index);
923      System.arraycopy(a, index+1, a2, index, a.length-index-1);
924      return a2;
925   }
926
927   class JsonNode {
928      Object o;
929      ClassMeta cm;
930      JsonNode parent;
931      String keyName;
932
933      JsonNode(JsonNode parent, String keyName, Object o, ClassMeta cm) {
934         this.o = o;
935         this.keyName = keyName;
936         this.parent = parent;
937         if (cm == null || cm.isObject()) {
938            if (o == null)
939               cm = session.object();
940            else
941               cm = session.getClassMetaForObject(o);
942         }
943         this.cm = cm;
944      }
945   }
946
947   JsonNode getNode(String url, JsonNode n) {
948      if (url == null || url.isEmpty())
949         return n;
950      int i = url.indexOf('/');
951      String parentKey, childUrl = null;
952      if (i == -1) {
953         parentKey = url;
954      } else {
955         parentKey = url.substring(0, i);
956         childUrl = url.substring(i + 1);
957      }
958
959      Object o = n.o;
960      Object o2 = null;
961      ClassMeta cm = n.cm;
962      ClassMeta ct2 = null;
963      if (o == null)
964         return null;
965      if (cm.isMap()) {
966         o2 = ((Map)o).get(parentKey);
967         ct2 = cm.getValueType();
968      } else if (cm.isCollection() && o instanceof List) {
969         int key = parseInt(parentKey);
970         List l = ((List)o);
971         if (l.size() <= key)
972            return null;
973         o2 = l.get(key);
974         ct2 = cm.getElementType();
975      } else if (cm.isArray()) {
976         int key = parseInt(parentKey);
977         Object[] a = ((Object[])o);
978         if (a.length <= key)
979            return null;
980         o2 = a[key];
981         ct2 = cm.getElementType();
982      } else if (cm.isBean()) {
983         BeanMap m = session.toBeanMap(o);
984         o2 = m.get(parentKey);
985         BeanPropertyMeta pMeta = m.getPropertyMeta(parentKey);
986         if (pMeta == null)
987            throw new ObjectRestException(HTTP_BAD_REQUEST,
988               "Unknown property ''{0}'' encountered while trying to parse into class ''{1}''",
989               parentKey, m.getClassMeta()
990            );
991         ct2 = pMeta.getClassMeta();
992      }
993
994      if (childUrl == null)
995         return new JsonNode(n, parentKey, o2, ct2);
996
997      return getNode(childUrl, new JsonNode(n, parentKey, o2, ct2));
998   }
999
1000   private Object convert(Object in, ClassMeta cm) {
1001      if (cm == null)
1002         return in;
1003      if (cm.isBean() && in instanceof Map)
1004         return session.convertToType(in, cm);
1005      return in;
1006   }
1007
1008   private static int parseInt(String key) {
1009      try {
1010         return Integer.parseInt(key);
1011      } catch (NumberFormatException e) {
1012         throw new ObjectRestException(HTTP_BAD_REQUEST,
1013            "Cannot address an item in an array with a non-integer key ''{0}''", key
1014         );
1015      }
1016   }
1017}
